intro: Tamonea lasiopetala, commonly known as the rough-leaved tamonea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
